intro: Houmiri guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese houmiri, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and red. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Houmiri guianensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
